Explanations about Options.-l(M):
Listen for an incoming connection rather than initiating a connection to a remote
 host. The destination and port to listen on can be specified either as non-optional
 arguments, or with options -s and -p respectively. Cannot be used together with -x
 or -z. Additionally, any timeouts specified with the -w option are ignored.
Explanations about Options.-p(M):
Specify the source port nc should use, subject to privilege restrictions and
 availability.
Explanations about Options.-z(M):
Only scan for listening daemons, without sending any data to them. Cannot be used
 together with -l.

Explanations about Options.-a(M):
Show both listening and non-listening sockets. With the --interfaces option, show
 interfaces that are not up
Explanations about Options.-l(M): Show only listening sockets. (These are omitted by default.)
Explanations about Options.-n(M): Show numerical addresses instead of trying to determine symbolic host, port or user names.

Explanations about Options.-p(M): Show the PID and name of the program to which each socket belongs.
